Reason: The 'keyspace_count_warn_threshold' configuration does not directly involve any performance-related operations that are time-extensive or memory-extensive within its related code. It simply sets a threshold for the number of keyspaces in the cluster and triggers a warning message when the threshold is exceeded. While having a large number of keyspaces can slow down schema-dependent cluster operations, this configuration itself does not have a notable performance impact at the system level. Therefore, it is classified as not performance-sensitive.
